detailsOfAchievement: LCVK has been working in the areas of Reproductive Health, Reproductive and Child Health, Comprehensive abortion care, social harmony, economic growth, education, vocational training, Consumer awareness, environment, health, agriculture etc.in different districts namely Nawada, Begusarai, Munger ,Khagaria, Lakhisarai, Patna, Arwal, Nalanda, Sheikhpura, Saharsha and Jamui District of Bihar state.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Low income group children identified which has no hope of formal education in school due to low income of their family members have been provided teaching learning materials, school uniform, shoes and school bags

Organising Second Generation Training for training of doctors and nursing staff of Begusarai and Munger District of Bihar for providing of Abortion services at their Health facilities. Regular follow up activities are done to help providers and nursing staff to know their difficulties in providing abortion services. Providing of updates and instruments, stationary and CAC News Letters regarding Comprehensive Abortion Care Services CAC News Letter

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Nav Bharat Jagriti Kendra Hazaribagh Jharkhand
sourceOfFunds.purpose: Mentally ill people from Nawada were identified and provided treatment and medicine free of cost till they were stabilized and do their own job. Stablised patients were rehabilitated and linked with social work. Some of them were linked with Self Help Group and were provided credit linkages for doing some own economic activity

Organising Second Generation Training for training of doctors and nursing staff of Begusarai and Munger District of Bihar for providing of Abortion services at their Health facilities. Regular follow up activities are done to help providers and nursing staff to know their difficulties in providing abortion services. Orientation of ASHAs and ANMs on safe abortion issues, infection prevention, proper waste management instrument processing etc. Providing of updates and instruments, stationary

FGD was organized for the adolescents, newlywed couples and elderly women of 5 panchayats of Nawada with support of Feminist Approach Technology Society of New Delhi for creating awareness generation among the aforesaid women group regarding effects of early marriage, bearing of child birth in early ages, consequences of more children in family, benefits of small family, etc. Presentation and slide shows were organized on aforesaid subjects for increasing effectiveness of the programme

Organising Second Generation Training for training of Doctors and Nursing Staff of Begusarai and Munger District of Bihar for providing of Abortion services at their Health facilities. Regular follow up activities are done to help providers and nursing staff to know their difficulties in providing abortion services. Orientation of ASHAs and ANMs on safe abortion issues, infection prevention, proper waste management, instrument processing etc. Providing of updates and instruments, stationary
Organizing TOT for having Master Trainers

Providing of Training to the Medical Officers and Nursing staffs on Comprehensive Abortion Care at Government Facilities Which in turn provide safe abortion services at their place of posting to the needy women by saving their lives and from the miseries.

To increase the awareness level of SHG leaders, Anganwadi workers, ASHAs grassroots social workers of Nawada District of Bihar. An awareness workshop was organised on 28th September 2019 at Sumangalam Hall, Postmortem road Naawada. Inaugration of workshop was done by Dr. Suniti Kumar MD and functionaries of different social organisation. Besides, Ms. Radha Arya, secretary and Mr. Rajendra Singh, PD. Need of Safe Abortion was facility was explained and a quiz was organised.

detailsOfAchievement: Mission for Human Dignity Trust (MHD), a registered Non-government organization (NGO) is working in Bihar since last ten years in the field of education, social service and other issues concerned with human dignity. The organization has set its vision to work for the above said sectors in effective way to uphold the level of mankind. This organization has a team of committed volunteers all over Bihar working for the betterment of society in terms of education and social issues. In the field of education, the organization is working on various projects like Educational guidance & Counseling program, Awareness for government scholarships and financial assistance to the poor students, adult education and other related activities. In the field of social service, the organization is committed to work for the betterment of financially challenged section of society. The program like blanket distribution among poor, vocational training for sewing & knitting, dress designing, readymade garments and embroidery for poor girls of society is running since last many years for their socio-economic development. Apart from it, the health issue and awareness has been an important program for the citizen of our society. In this regard, health and cleanliness is an effective program for their hygienic sense of living. Besides that, drug addiction camp is organized for the drug addicted peoples for convincing them to leave drug showing the harmful and hazardous impact of drug on our health. Such patients are also counseled with experts for their motivation to leave drug. Agriculture and Women are always in priority for the organization since its establishment. In the field of agriculture, the organization is running programs like farmers training, unity in village youths, awareness regarding horticulture, plantation etc. in which the farmers are trained for effective farming and important tips for agricultural techniques and youths of villages are united and motivated for working for the betterment of society. For women, apart from various vocational training for poor girls, the organization is working for the leadership development among women by organizing women camps in different locations of Bihar in which they are encouraged and motivated for their rights and resolving their issues and ultimately developing leadership among them to take on their issues with proper guidance. Technology transfer program is also an important program of the organization in which farmers are trained with the new technologies and their role in agriculture. Women are also trained regarding the new technological developments and its use for the betterment of women in our society. Disaster management is also an important program in which the youths are encouraged to learn the skill for disaster handling and helping peoples at this moment. As a whole, the Mission for Human Dignity Trust is working on various issues of society for upholding the dignity of mankind. The organization has vision for working further on various legal problems, agricultural problems, health problems and other areas of social life which is ultimately affecting the basic right of a citizen and their dignity.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Breaching of western embankments of Kamla River caused grim flood in Kiratpur and Ghanshyampur blocks of Darbhanga district in 2014. TDH (G) supported Humanitarian support to flood victims with focus on women and children by providing nutritional support to women, lactating mothers, pregnant women, old aged parsons, temporary shelter, food kits, health camp support and agriculture seeds. Agri seeds have been provided to flood affected farmes for restoring the farming,covered 1000families

Since 2011, Heifer International has been supporting to MGVP for promoting livelihood to weaker section and landless. With focus on women, particularly those who are affected by displacement due to flood. The location of the project is Kiratpur and Ghanshyampur blocks of Darbhanga district. The blocks are situated in between the embankments of Kosi and Kamal rivers. The aims of the project was to promote goat farming on business model by involving 320 women/16 women SHGs.

CRY supported MGVP for protection of Child Rights of displaced families, who were displaced due to construction of Kosi Mahasetu /Kosi Bridge over the Kosi river in between Nirmali and Supaul district in 2010. About 50,000 populations of 62 villages were displaced. In this background, CRY supported MGVP for protection of child rights of the displaced families. The major activities of the project were to form Child Committee/Bal Panchayats, Mother Committee, Women SHG ,Restoration of school.
Prof Rajiv Sinha, IIt Kanpur started a pilot project for optimum utilization of water logging areas of flood prone district in Bihar, and MGVP got opportunity to coordinate the project.

Heifer Project International supported this project to provide livelihood support to 6000 families of weaker section in Kiratpur and Ghanshyampur blocks of Darbhanga district by promoting goat farming on business model.
Protection of child rights of displaced families in Supaul district of Bihar.

title: MITHILA VIKASH SEVA ASHRAM
detailsOfAchievement: Growth of Drug abuse is a huge problem infront of the society. We should face this problem with unity. The M.V.S. arranged an awareness camp on Laheriya Sarai, Beta, Bela Shankar for the Prevention of drug abuse. Here we had experts from Navrang Drug De-Addiction cum Rehabilitation centre, Muzaffarpur. On the stall we show many types of literature for the precaution from drug abuse. The M.V.S. volunteers campaign door to door with experts. Volunteers and guest experts met with drug users including injecting drug users and counseled them to remove this addiction and to maintain sober life. Volunteers marked a positive result in society Mithila vikash Seva Ashram organized three awareness Camp on drug abuse and illicit trafficking in three Blocks Bochahan, Mushahari, & Kanti in Muzaffarpur District, In awareness camp programme, The topics were discussed on Drug use the disease concept, Co-relation between drug and HIV, Health related general concept, Income generation skill etc. The people were sensitized on these topics they were emphasized on the fact that co-relation between drug and HIV. We disseminated accurate and complete knowledge on these issues and clarified their misunderstanding. All the participants felt included. They satisfied enough. Organization also provides counseling facilities & referral services under this programme
